title: Mick Cleary's verdict: Tonga gave France a real fright (again) and if they had been more disciplined, French blushes would have been deep
text:
The storm clouds gathered over the Kumamato Stadium on a humid Sunday afternoon, then came a rumble of thunder, and as Tonga flanker Zane Kapeli leapt high into the air to touch down with just seconds remaining for a score that closed the gap to four points with a (successful) conversion to come, there were vivid flashes across the distant hills towards the city. Lightning? Again? Surely not!

Eight years ago in Wellington, Tonga pulled off the shock of the 2011 World Cup by beating France. Was there to be a repeat? Earlier, centre Malietoa Hingano had rounded off a bracing sequence to tee up Tonga. The skies darkened but neither the rains not the Tongan insurrection quite came to pass. But...
